attributes.action: Introduce licenses for Animal Rescue Centres
attributes.background: Rescue Centres and individuals do not currently need a local authority Pet Shop or Boarding Licence if they only receive donations. A lot are never inspected unless reported for horrific welfare conditions, many animals are suffering at the hands of unscrupulous people purely out to make money.

attributes.action: Provide free secure parking for haulage vehicles
attributes.background: Places like Germany/France/Spain etc have free parking for trucks, Why can't we?
attributes.additional_details: Truckers have limited time to drive, and they have to park somewhere for the night/day. Motorway service areas charge up to £30.00 often for poor food and cold and dirty showers, and not all companies will pay for this. So the driver has to park in lay-bys and Industrial estates risking their lives/loads/diesel etc... Let us urge the government to sort out somewhere for our truckers to park safely and freely in this country. Places like Germany/France/Spain etc have free parking for trucks, Why can't we?

attributes.action: The Prime Minister should advise Her Majesty the Queen to prorogue Parliament.
attributes.background: The Prime Minister should advise Her Majesty the Queen to prorogue Parliament suspending the current parliamentary session until 2nd April 2019 to prevent any attempts by parliamentarians to thwart Brexit on 29th March 2019. Preparations for no-deal/WTO will continue.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister's deal has been rejected. No further deal is available from the EU. Remaining in the EU is not an option. Extension or revocation of Article 50 is not an option. I believe the British people voted to leave with no mention of a deal and that WTO rules, to which Britain will default on 29th March 2019, are in Britain's best interests. We may get a better deal after, but not until, we have left.

attributes.action: Pay Carers an allowance equivalent to a fulltime job at the National Living wage
attributes.background: Paying unpaid carers would safeguard those requiring care making it a financially viable option for friends and family to look after those they love, Reducing pressure on 999 services and the NHS. Saving vast amounts of money per person. The carer who provides continuity in care is often forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
Primary carers currently receive £1.85 an hour which is £64.60 a week, £3359 a year. There are over 6,000,000 carers in the UK and 1.25 Million people provide unpaid care for more than 50 hours per week (NHS survey of carers 2009/2010; Census 2001, Office for National Statistics) Carers for people with dementia alone save the UK over £8 Billion per annum. 72% of carers are worse off financially as a result of becoming a carer and struggle to make ends meet (Carers UK 2008) 
This is a national disgrace!

attributes.action: Allow American author Robert Spencer to enter the UK and speak freely
attributes.background: The prominent American author Robert Spencer was barred from entering the UK in 2013. Despite having committed no crime, Mr Spencer was prevented from speaking in Britain following his criticisms of Islam, a subject on which he has written widely. He should not be denied UK entry because of this.
attributes.additional_details: Spencer was barred from entering Britain by then Home Secretary Theresa May. Mrs May deemed his presence in the UK as "not conducive to the public good". Spencer had committed no crime, had not incited violence, but expressed his views about the Koran and Mohammed. We demand that this ban is lifted and that Robert Spencer be allowed entry to the UK.

attributes.action: Grant the brown hare protection under S5 of the Wildlife and Countryside Act.
attributes.background:
The brown hare had a Species Action Plan under the UK Biodiversity Action Plan but no action was taken.  In parts of the country they are nearly extinct due to farming practices or hunting.

To save this much loved animal becoming yet another species on the verge of extinction. We need to act now!
attributes.additional_details:
Hares have minimal legal protection because they are considered a game species and can be shot throughout the year, including through their breeding season.

If Rabbit Haemorrhagic Disease (RHD) or Myxomatosis spreads to non-resistant hares the species could be virtually eradicated in a couple of years.

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/11/hares-dying-mysteriously-amid-fears-myxomatosis-has-jumped-rabbits/?fbclid=IwAR3bvRSj_M3Xg7uLULB8t2HTLZV6jtfCEcWHouOhr2FGD2rdQfuV8tsvvMw

attributes.action: Laws to be introduced on social networks on hate preaching against religion(s)
attributes.background: In the recent years numerous far right groups have insulted prophets of faiths including Prophet Muhammad PBUH, using public YouTube, Facebook and other social media platforms. I believe there needs to be a legal boundary set when discussing criticism against religions and their respective Prophets.
attributes.additional_details: The open rallies and social media networks require moderators to stop hate speech. We have far-right preachers who are creating disunity, disharmony against law abiding citizens. Where such speech/expressions incite religious intolerance e.g. in the event of an improper or even abusive attack on an object of religious veneration, the government should consider them to be incompatible with respect for the freedom of thought, conscience and religion and take proportionate restrictive measures.

attributes.action: To offer mammograms to all women over 30
attributes.background: Last year on the 22nd October I was diagnosed with breast cancer, one week later after my CT scan my whole world fell apart I was told my cancer had spread.I am only 46 years old 4 years under the governments recommended age for a mammogram I am pretty sure this would have been too late for me.

attributes.action: Ban the appalling conditions battery and barn hens are currently kept in.
attributes.background: I rescue ex battery chickens and in doing so I am appalled at the condition they are in on their arrival. No feathers, no muscle, underweight and traumatised. It is heartbreaking. If any other animal were seen in a such a condition, the owners would be prosecuted and banned from keeping animals.
attributes.additional_details: I belong to a Facebook forum of over 10,000 who have re homed ex battery chickens.  We rescue and give a new life to chickens, where they can see sky, feel sun and rain, scratch soil and flap wings. None of which they can do under the appalling intense farming conditions they are kept in. All animals have rights, but not if you are a chicken it seems. They can live productive lives for years but are slaughtered at 18 months, deemed to be no longer financially viable.  Please see www.bhwt.org.uk.

attributes.action: Stop Universal Credit and let claimants stay on the original benefits.
attributes.background: Universal Credit is a disgrace and forcing people on to the benefit is so cruel. It shouldn’t have been introduced. Many families are living are in debt, living in poverty, some claimants have took their own lives which is saddening.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May / The Government needs to put a stop to this and fast. People can’t make ends meet and and as said people took their own lives, families living in poverty what not evidence Is there ?

People’s lives have been and are still being ruined.

attributes.action: No cap or limit on compensation for Windrush Generation and their descendants
attributes.background: We want a fair compensation scheme for the Windrush Generation that is in line with compensation awarded by the courts in civil cases. There should be no artificial cap that will inadequately compensate those who have suffered emotionally, financially, lost their homes and citizenship.
attributes.additional_details:
Six months since Windrush Scandal was exposed there has been some progress and numerous apologies from the Prime Minster.The government intend to introduce a cap on all compensation claims despite the fact they did not recognise or consider any interim or hardship fund. The Windrush Generation plus others from the Commonwealth have paid their taxes and contributed to the wealth, prosperity and cultural identity of UK since WW2.The scheme needs to reflect this.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-44888187

attributes.action: Aesthetic medical treatments to only be performed by Doctors, Nurses & Dentists
attributes.background: Everyday we are hearing horror stories involving inexperienced and unqualified people administering medical treatments such as botox and derma fillers. There is an increasing need to regulate the aesthetic medical industry and provide awareness on the dangers.

attributes.action: Get independant panel research into vaccine damage in dogs and review protocol.
attributes.background:
Lepto vaccines are believed to be responsible for the serious illnesse/ death of dogs.
Major et al. (2014) investigated an outbreak of Lepto in Bern Switzerland.  298 dogs found with Lepto. Vaccination history was available for 251 of these dogs (84.2%) Of these 95% were fully vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details:
Distemper, Hepititis and Parvovirus are all conditions which can be tested for, a titre test would be healthier and safer than just routinely repeating the vaccine. 
Dogs can be FULLY VACCINATED AND STILL CONTRACT THESE CONDITIONS due to vaccine failure or high immunity carried by the dam. Therefore just blindly vaccinating does not work. 

We believe an independant panel will take a realistic view of the true dangers of vaccination.

attributes.action: Undertake an independent enquiry into the role of Russia in Brexit.
attributes.background: 30+ individuals have been charged by Special Counsel Mueller in his continuing investigation of Russian interference in the US presidential election. I feel that there is sufficient evidence that a parallel investigation into Russian interference on Brexit is warranted.
attributes.additional_details: Individuals charged or convicted under the Mueller enquiry are known to have met with key Brexit figures during the Brexit / US election campaigns, as well having contact with Wikileaks. Prominent pro-Brexit figures are also alleged to have met directly with representatives of Wikileaks and repeatedly visited the Russian embassy in London.

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Britain leaving the EU
attributes.background:
It's no secret that a vast amount of people who voted to leave the EU didn't realise what they were voting for. 

The Leave campaign said that leaving would create new trade deals, strengthen the economy and public services and reduce the number of incoming immigrants. But this is not happening.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May has really struggled so far in Brexit negotiations and time is running out. She's failing to secure trade deals and my personal biggest fear is the Irish Border, this could lead to a United Ireland.

May has lost support not only from the Cabinet but the whole nation. I'm calling for a second referendum, because if you voted to remain or to leave we need a final say. The Brexit decision was so tight and I just think that it help everyone if there was a second vote. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: Stop the Online Forums Bill 2017-18 becoming law.
attributes.background: Thought control by politicians, backed by the main stream media has led to ever more sinister intrusions into people's freedom to criticize public policy and assemble into campaign groups.
attributes.additional_details:
By requiring platforms to publish information about closed forums and making Administrators responsible for content is Orwellian and anti-democratic.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2017-19/onlineforums.html

attributes.action: Instruct the Government to seek an extension of Article 50
attributes.background: More time and a far better democratic process are required to identify a workable path forward on Brexit. Therefore, we call upon the British Parliament to instruct the government to propose an extension of Article 50 of more than one year beyond the designated withdrawal date.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty sets out that a Member State’s exit from the European Union may be deferred if “the European Council, in agreement with the Member State concerned, unanimously decides to extend this period.”

This extension would allow time for all relevant parties in the UK and in the EU to undertake a meaningful and inclusive dialogue with their citizens, and consider, negotiate and build a mutually beneficial future relationship, in whatever form that might take.

attributes.action: Raise awareness and fund research into Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG)
attributes.background: Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) affects 30-40 children (sometimes adults too) in the UK each year. Median survival is just 9 months. Radiotherapy, which is palliative, has been the only treatment for decades. More must be done to fund research into this disease.
attributes.additional_details: May 17th has been recognised in other countries as Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) Awareness Day. The UK Government and Parliament should consider using this day to raise awareness of DIPG.

attributes.action: Ban UK tour agents promotion of animal attractions which fail national standards
attributes.background: Currently there is absolutely no legislation which governs the practices of UK tour companies when operating abroad with regards to animal welfare. This means the tour companies are able to sell tickets to animal attractions which would be completely illegal in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
The lack of legislation abroad means tour companies have been able to promote and profit from highly controversial animal practices, many of which have been consistently documented to cause extreme animal suffering and are often environmentally unsustainable. 
Notable examples of such exploitation include: selling tickets to see or swim with whales and dolphins, selling opportunities to ride on overworked elephants or camels, selling tickets to meet tigers which are often sedated.

attributes.action: Increase funding for multi-disciplinary treatment centres for FND Patients.
attributes.background: Funding is needed to set up and increase service provision for multi-disciplinary treatment centres. Treatment requires specialist care with a team of neurologists, physiotherapists etc. which must be integrated to create an effective plan. Current options are limited & insufficient.
attributes.additional_details: Up to 1/3 of all neurological referrals are diagnosed with FND. Sufferers end up relinquishing their independence & become reliant on Carers, Aids and Adaptations. They are left unable to function & it’s vital we improve prospects. Medically Unexplained Symptoms (including FND) directly cost the NHS approximately £3.1 billion, with an additional £18 billion in indirect costs. With an NHS already under pressure, improving services and treatment for those with FND would greatly lift this burden.

attributes.action: Improve outcomes for children with meningitis by auditing national guidelines.
attributes.background: 30% of young babies with bacterial meningitis receive inappropriate pre-hospital management, which results in delays in getting help. An audit of national guidelines is key to improving early diagnosis and survival.
attributes.additional_details:
Meningitis is difficult to spot - 49% of children with the most common type of bacterial meningitis are sent home after a first GP visit. Parents/carers of these children should be given 'safety netting' information about meningitis and sepsis to protect their child.

Parents want consistent information and safety netting reduces GP re-attendance. 

An audit of NICE Guideline CG102 and Quality Standard QS19 will determine if safety netting information is offered and help improve outcomes.

attributes.action: Off-Payroll: Give full rights to workers classed as ‘employed for tax purposes'
attributes.background: Newly proposed reforms to tax the self-employed – known as Off-Payroll Working - introduces rules that enable firms to classify workers as ‘employed for tax purposes’, without providing them with any employment rights. This is wholly unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
New measures in the Off-Payroll Working consultation effectively introduce a new 15% tax for self-employed workers, while enabling firms to circumvent their obligation to give employment rights to workers. This opposes the intentions of the Government’s ‘Good Work Plan’, designed to prevent unscrupulous firms forcing vulnerable workers into precarious work.
Parliament must ensure self-employed workers cannot be classed as ‘employed for tax purposes’ without receiving full employment rights.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to leave dogs outside in winter without access to heated shelter
attributes.background: Frequently when the community contact the RSPCA with concerns about a dog being left outside in the cold for prolonged periods of time, they are told that nothing can be done if the dog has access to shelter. Often this consists of a wooden kennel which provides no protection from the cold.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 4 of the Animal Welfare Act 2006 already legislates against unnecessary suffering.  This Act should be amended to ensure any dog left outside for long periods of time during the winter months also has access to a heated shelter.  

If the owner fails to comply, then steps should be taken to prosecute the owner and the dog seized.

attributes.action: Allow people who make a living from the land to live where they work.
attributes.background: A presumption in planning law that people making a living off the land can live where they work would encourage the creation of rural enterprises and assist with the housing issues for rural workers.  It would therefore promote a thriving rural economy and increase food security.
attributes.additional_details: For more information, see www.bulworthy.uk/petition

attributes.action: Create a Freedom of Speech Act and Bring an End to "Hate Speech" laws
attributes.background:
Who defines "Hate"

For several years now the government has been infringing people's' most basic rights to speak freely on matters, by deeming their speech "offensive" or "hateful" and declaring that such speech, even online, warrants being fined or jailed. This is an outrage!
attributes.additional_details:
We demand the legal right to Free Speech, in an Act which will bring an end to the ludicrous notion that "hate speech" and "offensive speech" deserves people be imprisoned or charged. In short, an Act to codify the citizens' right to freedom of speech without government intervention.

Ideas must be fought with other ideas, not with force. 


Naturally this precludes that the current laws criminalizing "hate speech" be rescinded.

attributes.action: Make Dydd Gwyl Dewi (St David's day) an official Holiday in Wales
attributes.background: The 1st of March is the National Day of Wales, when Welsh Culture and History is celebrated. This important day in our Nation's Calendar should be a bank holiday, just like Ireland has St Patrick's day and Scotland has St Andrew's day, we should also have St David's day a bank holiday in Wales.

attributes.action: To appoint independent facilitator to engage MLAs in talks and resolve impasse
attributes.background: This petition, from the We Deserve Better movement, demands that the UK Government do everything in its power to get MLAs to solve their outstanding issues and re-establish effective government for all or have their salaries further cut.
attributes.additional_details: As of September 14th Northern Ireland will have been without a government for 606 days. We Deserve Better is not affiliated to any political party it is a campaign by and for the people. It demands that the UK government work with the Irish Government to appoint an independent facilitator to proactively reinvigorate discussions between all parties. If the parties do not agree to actively engage in discussions to solve the outstanding issues with immediate effect and re-establish a legislative body, as a parallel process, we demand that the UK government cut the salaries of MLAs.

attributes.action: Repeal the European Communities Act 1972 as a matter of urgency
attributes.background: Under this law the UK Parliament passed the European Communities Act. It gave direct effect to EU law and meant that if there was a conflict between an act of the British Parliament and EU law, Parliament lost out and EU law prevailed. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35766434
attributes.additional_details:
If we repeal this law then we can negotiate a no deal hard brexit on our terms as opposed to their terms.

The UK government announced it was doing this in 2016- given the Brexit deadline of 29th March this must be done sooner (https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-announces-end-of-european-communities-act)

attributes.action: Order immediate adjournment of the Brexit process during the NCA Investigation
attributes.background: The NCA is investigating criminal offences relating to electoral law on the behalf of Brexit supporting campaigners.
attributes.additional_details:
This is serious enough to warrant a view that the 2016 referendum result should be questioned.
 
Therefore the process should be adjourned while the facts and position are investigated.
 
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/news/1498-nca-initiates-investigation-following-electoral-commission-referral
 
https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/our-work/roles-and-responsibilities/our-role-as-regulator-of-political-party-finances/sanctions/report-on-investigation-into-payments-made-to-better-for-the-country-and-leave.eu

attributes.action: Change sentencing guidelines for causing death by careless or dangerous driving
attributes.background: Our son-in-law and granddaughter were killed in a RTA. The other driver was charged with causing death by dangerous driving but acquitted, then pleaded to careless driving. He received a 10 month suspended sentence for 2 years with a 3 year driving ban (he was not given a custodial sentence).
attributes.additional_details: They were killed when he hit their stationary car which was stopped in the nearside lane of the road attending to a breakdown with a recovery vehicle in attendance. They were standing outside away from their car when the accused van ploughed into it and it was catapulted into them. The sentencing never reflects the crime!!!

attributes.action: Ensure that funding from the lottery is given to transgender support charities
attributes.background: Mermaids is a registered charity which offers support to trans people under the age of 16. The Big Lottery Fund are reviewing their grant after they have received a ‘number of correspondence’. A lot of negative information around the charity has been circulated by the media.
attributes.additional_details: The charity supports young people where at the moment there is little or no support. It is evident that it is the support which the charity offers which is the issue rather than any policy issues within the charity itself. Given this, the Government should set an objective to ensure that the Big Lottery Fund supports charities like Mermaids.

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin the E.U on March 29, 2019.
attributes.background: If the United Kingdom leaves the EU on March 29, 2019, we want to immediately apply to rejoin even if this means accepting conditions such as Schengen borders and the common (EURO) currency.
attributes.additional_details: #stopbrexit

attributes.action: Provide funds to reopen main road (A422) between Banbury and Brackley
attributes.background: The main A road (A422) between Banbury and Brackley is closed to traffic after a bridge was deemed structurally unsafe. Bankrupt Northamptonshire County Council have no money to repair the bridge. We want central Government to step in and reopen the A422.
attributes.additional_details:
The A422 between Banbury and Brackley is an important access route between local towns, villages, jobs, schools and services, between the M1, A43 and M40. Diverted traffic is using unsuitable single track roads and roads through villages adding time, costs and danger. 

Bankrupt Northamptonshire County Council have no money to repair Farthinghoe bridge. We want central Government to step in and provide funds to reopen the A422.

attributes.action: Keep the Royal Air Force Aerobatic Team, the Red Arrows, in Lincolnshire
attributes.background: Lincolnshire has had strong links with the Royal Air Force since before its founding in 1918 and the Royal Air Force Aerobatic Team has been synonymous with Lincolnshire for more than 30 years. The Red Arrows team should be kept in the county if RAF Scampton is to close.
attributes.additional_details:
Tourism contributes £1.3billion to the Lincolnshire economy and the county's aviation heritage attracts people from all over the world. This came to the fore in 2018 with the RAF Lincolnshire promotion to mark the county’s long history to the RAF at 100. 

The Red Arrows team was formed in 1964 and has been based in Lincolnshire since 1983.

Please see visitlincoln.com/RAF to learn about Lincolnshire's links to aviation and the Royal Air Force, including how you can experience it today.

attributes.action: Allow second-degree medical students access to a SLC tuition fee loan.
attributes.background: Graduate students who gain a place on a 5-year undergraduate medicine program are not currently entitled to a tuition fee loan from the SLC. This is preventing those from working class and disadvantaged backgrounds from being able to study medicine.
attributes.additional_details: For graduates who decide to study medicine they have a higher chance in gaining a place on an undergraduate medical degree, which has reserved places for graduates. However, these students are not entitled to a tuition fee loan from the SLC, and so have to fund the first 4 years of tuition themselves - £37,000. Thus only those from wealthier backgrounds are able to afford this route, whilst those from disadvantaged backgrounds compete for very limited and competitive graduate medicine programs.

attributes.action: Revoke Article 50 and remain in the EU.
attributes.background: The government repeatedly claims exiting the EU is 'the will of the people'. We need to put a stop to this claim by proving the strength of public support now, for remaining in the EU. A People's Vote may not happen - so vote now.

attributes.action: Be fair to Bees, Plan Bee –Help farmers safeguard our valuable Nature!
attributes.background: Young people from Northern Ireland are asking government to support devolved institutions by having a UK wide strategy to provide funding to support farmers delivering valuable ecosystem services, such as providing wildflowers for pollinators.
attributes.additional_details: Our Co Down research 2018 has shown that wildlife-friendly farming supported four times the number of pollinators compared to a farm that had never been managed for wildlife. Insect pollinated crops are valued at £603M per year (UK National Ecosystem Assessment). What food can we buy? How much will it cost us? Can we go out into nature and still be astounded by its beauty? Without bees, we dread to know the answers. The question is not should we save bees, but why have we not already started?

attributes.action: Amend the law and reclassify the meaning of 'intentionally homeless'.
attributes.background: At present, under the law, tenants who are served 'notice' are encouraged by their local council to remain in their home; for, if they leave, they are bizarrely classified as 'intentionally homeless' and are unlikely to be housed as a priority.
attributes.additional_details: Conventional wisdom would say that if a tenant is served notice by a landlord, then they must leave. However, local councils are increasingly encouraging tenants to remain until a landlord is able to obtain a County Court Judgement in which bailiffs forcibly remove a tenant as this is the only way a tenant can qualify for long-term rehousing under the current law. This is cost prohibitive to both tenants and landlords and must be changed- being served 'notice' is not an act of intentional homelessness

attributes.action: Conduct an Independent Public Inquiry into the Windrush Scandal
attributes.background: We call upon the  Head of Government to put in place a full public inquiry to determine the injustice and racism caused with an independent panel appointed in which people can have faith in order to determine the truth, who is responsible and who will be held accountable for this gross injustice.
attributes.additional_details:
The scope should include but not be limited to;
 Windrush generation & their multi-generational families
Numbers detained/deported
Impact; loss of job /home/destitution Denied access to services, education, training,  benefits, impact on mental /physical health,families
How many have died including suicide
How many deported under Operation Nexus 
Who was responsible for the whole and elements of the Windrush scandal.
The extent to which it was driven by institutional/direct/indirect racism.

attributes.action: 16 and 17 year olds to be allowed to vote in a referendum on the Brexit deal.
attributes.background: if Parliament supports a final referendum on the deal to leave the EU it is important that young people are listened to through the ballot box. It happened in the Scottish Independence Referendum and there are no barriers to it happening in a referendum on the final EU deal.

attributes.action: Stop rapists from accessing children conceived through rape
attributes.background: Rotherham Grooming Scandal Whistleblower & Rape Survivor Sammy Woodhouse had a baby as result of her abuser raping her repeatedly. In 2017 she discovered her rapist, who was sentenced to 35 years, was entitled to parental rights meaning he could access her son.
attributes.additional_details: Sammy took the courageous and traumatic step of forgoing her anonymity to ensure her rapist & other members of the grooming gang went to jail. Her rapist was found guilty of 23 child sex offences. Then in 2017 the authorities approached her rapist without her knowledge. She is calling for a simple amendment to the Children’s Act 1989 which would ban any male with a child conceived by rape from applying for access/rights.

attributes.action: Uphold current Responsible Pharmacist rulings and reject Remote Supervision
attributes.background: The rebalancing board have put forward a proposal named 'Remote Supervision' whereby they want to allow technicians to supervise the sale of pharmacy and prescription only medication and want to allow pharmacists to be signed in as a Responsible Pharmacist for more than one pharmacy at a time.
attributes.additional_details: The remote supervision of pharmacies will mean that pharmacists will be legally responsible for more than one pharmacy at a time and therefore legally responsible for pharmacies which they have no way of effectively supervising. Also, pharmacy technicians will be allowed to hand out pharmacy only and prescription only medications with no input from a qualified Pharmacist. This will be detrimental to patient healthcare. More information can be found on the PDA website.

attributes.action: Parliament to ban sale of mist nets except to those with an appropriate licence.
attributes.background: Mist nets are being sold as anti bird netting online. These will trap birds which will die if not released, or be injured by untrained persons trying to release them. The nets cost from £1.44. At present it is not illegal to sell or own a mist net, but it is illegal to operate one without a licence.

attributes.action: UK Government to raise the case of  Jonathan Nash with the Qatari Government.
attributes.background: Jonathan Nash has been sentenced to 37 years in a Qatari prison. His crime? Nothing more than a bounced cheque. In line with Qatar’s judiciary system (or lack of) he has not been given the opportunity to defend himself. No day in court and no opportunity to state his case.

attributes.action: New independent complaints & monitoring body for schools & local authorities
attributes.background: Legislation and DfE guidance state how schools and local authorities must comply with the law. If statutory guidance or duties are not followed, enforcement is left to solo families using ineffective complaint procedures, or the LGO service, which won’t act in the face of ultra vires local policies.
attributes.additional_details: This problem often relates to SEN support, mental or physical illness provision, bullying, or disability discrimination. The lack of accountability in the system creates severe difficulties for families & denies many children the support & education they need. ‘Not Fine in School’ call for a new independent, transparent & objective body to enable a fair complaints process, which is NOT investigated by the complained of services. This body must be empowered to monitor practices & instigate consequences when schools or local authorities use local (invalid) policies, or act in an ultra vires way.

attributes.action: Georgia’s law: Require stay drug safe measures and testing at all festivals
attributes.background: Georgia Jones died at Mutiny festival May 26th 2018 after taking two pills. All festivals should have drug safe measures. Alongside security checks and dogs, there should be clear warning signs of potential side effects. Front of house testing would also give more information to the individuals.
attributes.additional_details: Research has proven that all these measures do help and make people think twice, with half choosing not to take. Searches do not stop drugs getting in. Education and advice is what is needed.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Larsen Traps which cause great suffering to corvids
attributes.background: A corvid, usually a crow or magpie is held captive in a small cage, which attracts other corvids who are then killed.  The bird's most vital instincts are denied, and neglect is rife. No one knows where the traps are and The Animal Welfare Act cannot be enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
Even smarter than humans!

The crows were able to carry out both tasks and to switch between them as appropriate. That demonstrates a high level of concentration and mental flexibility which few animal species can manage — and which is an effort even for humans.
The new findings were just published in the Journal Nature Communications.
Institute for Neurobiology, University of Tübingen




Corvids are on a par with the great Apes in terms of intelligence.
Regardless of any comparisons of various brain measurements, one can conclude that the similarities between corvids and great apes in complex cognitive skills also hold for at least one less taxing skill: motor self-regulation.

 Royal Society Open Science, 2016; 3 (4): 160104 DOI: 10.1098/rsos.160104

attributes.action: Implement Agriculture as a compulsory subject up to YR9 and an option for GCSE.
attributes.background: Agriculture on a whole is an extremely important industry, it is used by everyone across the country, across the globe and it's not just for food! Hopefully, teaching children and young adults correct and factual information will help support UK and worldwide farmers and the industry in the future.
attributes.additional_details: I see extremely worrying false and skewed information floating around that unfortunately people are desperate to believe. It's time we finally try to do something about it and save the most important industry, I feel, on this planet in a constructive and educational way. I believe that giving children and young adults the facts in a structured lesson, weekly, will enable the next generation to grow up knowing the true importance, the factual information and have the love for UK Agriculture.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all non-recyclable and unsustainable food packaging
attributes.background: Today the Earth is at a crisis point due to our plastic consumption, and as a result, people in the UK are more willing than ever to engage in recycling. Yet so much food packaging remains completely, frustratingly unrecyclable. Let's aim for the UK to lead the world with a 100% recycling rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day we send to landfill, to decompose over thousands of years:
Cereal box inner bags
Peel-off film (fruit and veg punnets/ready meals/yoghurt pots)
Almost all plastic supermarket fruit and veg packets
Crisp packets
Sweets wrappers
Chocolate bar wrappers
Styrofoam
Vacuum pack plastic
-to name a few
The British public WANTS to recycle but we can't get away from the vast amounts of waste that poorly designed packaging creates- appoint people to design alternatives and the UK will thank you!

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of animal products in public. Including meat, dairy and fur.
attributes.background:
There is substantial evidence of the serious links between the farming of animals and it's devastating effect on our environment. There is equally as strong evidence that the consumption of animal based diets is harmful to our health.
Animal agriculture for meat, dairy, eggs and clothing is cruel.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Nations and World Health Organisation, as well as leading scientists and medical experts have and are continuing to evidence this as fact. 
Non human animals are sentient beings, they feel pain and emotion, as we do.
We must act for the planet, our health and the farmed and wild animals of the world, for a better future for all.
By continuing to advertise these products we are creating consumers and habits that are having negative impacts on all.
